name: 8bitdemos
body:
### A collection of early '90s-style demos, written in JavaScript

To simulate [Mode 13h](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mode_13h), a small (and as of yet, highly unoptimized) lib called [Canvas256](https://github.com/8bitdemos/demos/blob/gh-pages/js/canvas256.js) is used.

Canvas256 provides a 320x180 HTML5 canvas, which can be manipulated in 256-color palette mode (palette effects such as old school fire are doable).

The demos have been tested on (best results in descending order):
* Mozilla Firefox 27
* Apple Safari 7
* Internet Explorer 11
* Google Chrome 32

Currently (and to the best of my knowledge), only FF and Safari support nearest-neighbor interpolation. IE and Chrome instead use bilinear interpolation, which doesn't look as crisp.
